overview: "In Japan, they say there are several tortures, such as a blood pond, a needle mountain, and a place with burning fire in hell. I picked one of these, a blood pond, to create my image of animation. There is a heaven and hell in everyone’s mind and I think that people dance because we feel heaven and hell inside ourselves. I made many of the images using a kids’ graphic computer called “My First Sony,” which was very easy to use, and I edited these graphics into animation by using a Sony Handicam V-88 in its animation function." - Tamami Asada
title: Place Where Dance Was Born
